etymologies: Old English storc, of Germanic origin; probably related to stark (because of its rigid stance)

definitions: a tall long-legged wading bird with a long heavy bill and typically with white and black plumage.

notes.text: Family Ciconiidae: several genera and species, in particular the white stork (Ciconia ciconia), with black wing tips and a reddish bill and legs, often nesting on tall buildings in Europe

shortDefinitions: very tall long-legged wading bird with long heavy bill and white and black plumage

definitions: the white stork as the pretended bringer of babies.
shortDefinitions: white stork as supposed bringer of newborn babies
